results.title: Horace Goes Skiing for ZX Spectrum
results.creator_credit: William Tang, Melbourne House, Psion Software and Beam Software
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette and cover in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Horace Goes Skiing [computer game]. Horace Goes Skiing is a single player game with multiple genres. The first is similar to Frogger, where players begin with $40 and guide Horace across a busy road to the ski lodge. Getting hit by a vehicle costs Horace $10 in ambulance fees. Once Horace makes it to the lodge and hires skiis, it becomes a ski game where players slalom between flags and avoid trees. Colliding with a tree will send Horace back to the start of the game. When Horace runs out of money, the game ends.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Tang, Melbourne House, Psion Software and Beam Software

When Horace runs out of money, the game ends.

results.title: Hungry Horace for ZX Spectrum
results.creator_credit: Melbourne House, Psion Software and Beam Software
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette and cover in a plastic cassette case
results.brief_description:
Hungry Horace offered gameplay based of the popular arcade game Pac-Man. It was celebrated as the first arcade game for the Spectrum. It was one of the few Spectrum games that were also available in ROM format. It formed part of the Horace series, which included Horace Goes Skiing and Horace and the Spiders and the unpublished Horace to the Rescue.

Horace is a blue blob with arms and legs, who wanders around a maze, picking the flowers, collecting fruit and avoiding the park guards, who are out to capture him. He is able to momentarily scare the guards, making them vulnerable, by ringing a bell in the maze. If Horace is able to escape capture and leave the maze, he moves to the next, more challenging level.

Source: Play It Again website:
http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/hungry-horace-orginal-spectrum/

Last accessed: 17/05/2021

Original game developed by Beam Software and Psion Software. Published in 1982 by Melbourne House.

results.title: Australia's Best: Music & Images of Australians in the 80's
results.creator_credit: Pom Oliver, South Pacific Films and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A music video documentary showcasing the best of Australia’s popular music in the eighties. Features the music of Split Enz, Australian Crawl, INXS, No Fixed Address, Cold Chisel and Icehouse. Includes interviews with celebrities such as Michael Hutchence, Neil and Tim Finn, James Reyne and Grace Knight.
results.title_for_label: Australia’s Best: Music & Images of Australians in the 80’s
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pom Oliver, South Pacific Films and New South Wales Film Corporation

results.title: Australian super 8 films 1981-1986
results.brief_description: The early 1980s saw an emergence of a Super 8 film culture. The three hour compilation tape features 27 Super 8 films produced by Australian artists between 1981 and 1986. It attempts to be a representative survey of prominent filmmakers, themes and style. A rare and important documentation of a fertile aspect of Australian film and visual arts activities. Curated by Michael Hutak, Super 8 Group Australia.
results.description: The early 1980s saw an emergence of a Super 8 film culture. The three hour compilation tape features 27 Super 8 films produced by Australian artists between 1981 and 1986. Curated by Michael Hutak, Super 8 Group Australia.

results.title: Las Patronas
results.brief_description: Las Patronas, Mexican women’s group giving food aid to migrants crossing the border
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Las Patronas (The Bosses), a group of Mexican volunteers, have been passing food and water to South and Central American migrants heading to the US border on top of freight trains. This video has been widely shared and celebrated on social media, highlighting the compassion being shown to migrants on the US/Mexico border. Some viewers have questioned if its virality puts the work in danger, but Las Patronas shared the original video to raise awareness and fund their work. According to a 2014 article, the group was formed 19 years earlier, so they’ve been helping people for almost 30 years – far longer than social media has been around. The group was nominated for the Princess of Asturias Award in 2015, after a campaign from Change.org that collected more than 50,000 signatures in support. In a time when Central and South American migration is being used for political stunts in America - like Texas Governor Greg Abbot bussing migrants to Vice President Kamala Harris’ residence on Christmas Eve - Las Patronas depoliticise the media narrative and focus on humanity.

You can find out more about the group on their website (in Spanish) and follow them on Twitter.
description_for_label: Las Patronas (The Bosses), a group of Mexican volunteers, have been passing food and water to South and Central American migrants heading to the US border on top of freight trains. This video has been widely shared and celebrated on social media, highlighting the compassion being shown to migrants on the US/Mexico border. Some viewers have questioned if its virality puts the work in danger, but Las Patronas shared the original video to raise awareness and fund their work. According to a 2014 article, the group was formed 19 years earlier, so they’ve been helping people for almost 30 years – far longer than social media has been around.

results.title: Drat
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Robert Stephenson, Ann Shenfield, Sarah Watt and Elizabeth O'Neill
results.brief_description: A bunch of lab rats one night decide to break out and escape from their cages in the laboratory. One brain damaged rat, as a result of receiving shock-treatment, initially resists the call. This claymation reveals in its close yet another fiendish experiment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Robert Stephenson, Ann Shenfield, Sarah Watt and Elizabeth O’Neill

results.title: Sydney Harbour Bridge. Bondi. Sydney Bush. Cars
results.brief_description: A compilation of four experimental films made by filmmaker, Paul Winkler, between 1977 - 1980: “Sydney Harbour Bridge”, “Bondi”, “Sydney Bush” and “Cars”.

results.title: Overland with Cobb & Co.
results.brief_description: A journey through the outback by Cobb & Co coach. Cobb & Co have a unique place in Australia’s past. The growth of the company went hand in hand with the development of rural Australia. In many ways it made development possible, providing an essential fast transport system on which the rural areas depended. By 1870 Cobb & Co were harnessing 6,000 horses a day to haul their coaches over 28,000 of track every week.

By 1870 Cobb & Co were harnessing 6,000 horses a day to haul their coaches over 28,000 of track every week.
